description:
The Bakeologists is a multi site modern inner city Bakery/Cafe looking to add a couple of bakery/cafe FOH all rounders to join our team.
We have multiple job opportunities due to business expansion and our new shop opening in The Gap. This store is due to open first week of March and training will take at The Bakeologists New Farm from now until The Bakeologists The Gap shop opens.
We are looking for people that are positive and energetic with a can do attitude. The latest our shops close is 5pm (approximate 5:30pm finish) so there are no late nights with this role. (We can discuss availability of shifts).
We are a successful multi site business with a strong and consistent customer base and a loyal longserving team. A quality driven business, our focus is on quality product, service and operations.
Day to day duties include, customer service, shop front merchandising, coffee making and standard everyday hospitality business cleaning.
The positions are open to all ability experience levels, new to the workforce or highly experienced. Unfortunately the positions aren't open to working holiday makers, we are looking for longer term team members.
If you're after a professional, consistent, stable, friendly workplace, apply now.
Please include a cover letter with which your role you would like to apply for, location and why we should have you in our team.

Table 26 was established with the “Eat, Drink, & Love Life” philosophy back in 2017. This is the owner’s, Amit, dad’s philosophy. After Amit’s dad passed away, Table 26 was born in his honour. We strive to create the best environment for our customers AND for our team members, just like Amit’s dad has done in their first cafe together. We believe that happy employees equals happy customers.
As a barista all rounder, your day-to-day duties will include (but not limited to)

 Opening and closing of the cafe
 Greeting and serving customers and maintaining a friendly presence
 Making coffees, cold drinks and preparing cakes & pastries
 All rounder duties that includes but not limited to clearing tables, washing dishes, taking the bins out, cleaning, table service
 Keeping tabs on the stock levels and reporting to the manager - also responsible for ordering
 Building rapport with regular customers

To be successful in this role, you need

 Experience in coffee making in a medium to fast paced environment for a minimum of 1.5 to 2 years
 Ability to adjust and maintain the coffee grind according to taste & recipe throughout the day
 Be able to make basic latte art (will provide further training for the right candidate)
 Ability to multitask while keeping a cool and friendly demeanour

We are looking for someone that we can UPSKILL and someone who wants to grow in the hospitality industry. We pay award rates (Restaurant Industry Award) and we provide growth opportunities for the right candidate. On top of growth opportunities and working with a great team, you also get to have delicious coffee and staff meal discounts.
We have 25 hours plus (can offer more or less depending on your availability) on offer to start with and are looking for a long-term team member. We look forward to hearing from you.

positionName: Cafe service staff and Barista's at Brisbane CBD

description:
About us
Table 26 Group is looking for an experienced Manager/ Barista All Rounder for our West End branch. We are looking for a customer-focused Manager that can provide the best service possible to our regulars and maintain a consistent standard of service. Table 26 was built on “Eat, Drink, & Love Life” values. We value work life balance and strive to create the best working environment possible.
Requirements

 Either a minimum of two years of experience as a Barista in Australia in a fast-paced cafe (Being Campos Coffee trained is a plus - but not required as we will further up-skill you) OR able to demonstrate the ability to produce consistently good shots following a recipe and texture milk perfectly to produce latte art in a fast paced environment.
 Rostering experience - MUST HAVE (Experience in Deputy rostering app is a plus).
 Ability to prioritise and make difficult decisions in fast paced environment
 Ability to professionally diffuse disgruntled customer situations with empathy and tact.
 Professional presentation, impeccable hygiene and high standards of cleanliness.
 Excellent customer service, with a friendly, happy demeanour.
 Effective problem-solving and troubleshooting experience.
 Proactive approach, with a "can-do attitude", genuine “care factor” and a “whatever it takes" thinking
 Ability to lead the team by example and inspire the team to achieve great customer service goal together. 
 Punctual with excellent time-management and prioritising.
 All rounder skill set required (includes but not limited to): wait work, dishes, clean up & pack up, ordering, opening & closing.

Responsibilities

 Roster efficiently and meet labour cost target without compromising service
 Barista all-rounder duties
 Cash register reconciliation
 Supervise and lead fellow team members
 Stock control
 Customer feedback response
 Open & close the store
 Meet KPI targets

Benefits

 Employee discount
 Free drinks
 Professional growth opportunity within Table 26 Group

The Shingle Inn has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Café Supervisor to lead a team and work within a well-established national café brand. Join our fun and fast paced team showcasing your leadership skills, passion for customer service and your fantastic organisational skills!
With over 85 years experience Shingle Inn is a truly unique cafe, serving our handmade, decadent cakes, delicious food and superior coffee! We are committed to providing superior products and exceptional customer service.
Job tasks and responsibilities:

 Maintaining an exceptionally high standard of customer service
 Ensuring quality control is maintained on all food and drink products
 Maintain and implement marketing campaigns, displays and sales techniques
 Cash management including reconciliations & banking
 Stock control and conducting regular stocktakes
 Maintaining strong team motivation and ongoing team training & development
 Adhering to and monitoring Workplace Health and Safety standards
 Manage daily operational needs including food costs, wage costs & other expenses

To be successful, you will:

 Have a ‘can do’ attitude that strives to exceed customer expectations
 Have a minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Café Supervisor
 Strong Barista skills and all-rounder skills
 Have demonstrable skills in leading and motivating a team
 Be available across a 7-day roster

We are looking for hard working and dedicated people to join our team. A busy store but a great opportunity for staff to get in depth training and grow with our business. Hours available will be between 3:30am and 6pm Monday to Sunday. Preferably those who have had previous cafe/ restaurant experience in a high volume, fast paced environment. Previous Drive thru experience is not a requirement but will be highly regarded. The role will be a true cafe all-rounder, including but not limited to customer interaction, food prep & service, cleaning tasks, P.O.S, coffee making and more.

positionName: Cafe All-Rounder - Shingle Inn Mt Ommaney

description:
Do you have experience working in food production, commercial cleaning or perhaps as a kitchen hand?
Are you looking for consistent work, Monday to Friday? Or perhaps you're looking for just 3 to 4 days (we can work around study schedules).
Read on!

 Monday to Friday, 7am to 3:30pm ish
 No weekends or late nights.
 West End location

We're a wholesale dessert business based in West End, we produce plant based sweets in large qty's that we ship all over Australia. We're looking for team members to slice, roll, pack products and clean.
Tasks will vary, they'll include:

 Working with our ball rolling machine, packing the finished product into boxes.
 Assembling packaging and packing products.
 Assisting with packing orders.
 Slicing cake slabs and brownies.
 General set up and pack down.
 Dishes, machine cleaning.

What's really important to us:

 A minimum of two years working within a cleaning role or food production environment. This could be within a cafe, hotel, restaurant, food processing or a commercial cleaning role etc.
 Through understanding of food hygiene practices and you keep a clean work station.
 An enthusiastic, upbeat and hard working attitude (we take this REALLY seriously, our team are positive and friendly, anyone who's a glass half empty kind of person, grunts as their form of communication or doesn't like taking direction - please don't apply).
 You show initiative, if you walk past something on the floor you pick it up. If you notice something needs doing, you do it or bring it to our attention.
 Great communication, when given a direction you're responsive and positive. When asked a question you're not limited to one word answers.
 Reliable, you understand you're part of a team and know that cancelling shifts last minute (genuine sickness excused) will leave your team members struggling to catch up.

The benefits of this role:

 You will enjoy a friendly, efficient team environment with full training provided.
 Consistent work, Monday to Friday.
 Centrally located in West End

We would love to hear from you if you feel you have the personal attributes and skills required to fulfil this role and join our team!
